caption: Pizza was great! Took a menu for next time
This place has great pizza A nice atmosphere. Great family place. The prices are surprisingly reasonable. An authentic Chicago family restaurant!
Live this joint
We had a great day but there is something that needs to improve! Great food and place, but good customer service is important!
Great day bartender.  Salads and pastas are outstanding.

This joint has a great corner bar appeal. Their menu focuses on Pizza and other Italian fare and their servers are always friendly. In the late afternoon and dinner hours the bar can be more busy than the dining room proper which I suppose is either a blessing or a curse. I think its very nice as it is but I'm guessing the owners would rather see those seats filled. So everyone reading this should go and fill a seat, you should drink some wine and eat pasta will listening to the trains rattle by or watch as people pass while sitting in one of the window booths.

Today, June 11, 2020, just before 2:00 PM I had the displeasure of being called  the "N" word, told to go "F" my mother and other derogatory names  all because I blew my horn at the driver of the Boni Vino van that was sitting at the stop light on Wells just before Congress as the light had turn green. When I attempted to go around the van the driver accelerated.  After turning onto Congress I pulled forward whereupon the driver became even more belligerent!  I inquired "are you serious...you're calling me all these names when the name of the business is posted all over the van?"  I guess it didn't matter at that point as the driver began making obscene gestures with his tongue.  Well, I guess the driver of the van, Illinois plate number ending in 1641 with the name of Boni Vino Restaurant plastered all over the van didn't care about what his employer would say when they see this review.
Very cozy place on downtown Chicago busy streets.  It's right next to the CBT and business offices. It's rustic, and good bartender and staff that treats you well.  Pizza is good 👍

I visited Boni Vino Thursday the 5th. I’m not impressed at all. I’ll start by the waitress wasn’t very pleasant, she spilled the butter dish in my lap, and almost spilled my friends beverage. We had both ordered the stuffed shells. To sit and wait roughly 15 minutes to be told they only have one order left. ( which I understand this happens) so I was given several choices to replace my original order. I had chosen mixed ravioli. Well my meat filled noodles were under cooked, and my sauce was very watery, not to mention that the cheese ravioli was just warm. I left a $6. Tip cash. To later check my balance only to find my bill was larger than what my charge was..... I was charged an extra $7.90 to my card. I DO NOT recommend!!!!!  By the looks of my receipt I was charged for a 20% tip. Even after leaving a 6% cash tip. The food nor the service warranted a $13.90 tip.

The service was horrible and the food not too far from it.  My eggplant was extremely salty and it took 15 minutes to get a refill on my water and it wasn't very crowded.  I heard the waiter apologize to the other two customers for their wait as well.  Will never go back again.

Place has a bad vibe to it. Hard to explain. And don’t want to bring race into it but the moment I walked into the restaurant I immediately felt as if I was somewhere I had no business being period. It wasn’t a welcoming feeling at all. Purchased the 5 dollar slice. It did not compare to any restaurant I’ve been to with the same deal. It was honestly terrible. The guy in front with the glasses wouldn’t even hand me my food. He literally told me it was ready and placed it on the counter while I was reaching for it thinking he was handing it to me. He literally placed it on the counter and brushed past me.
Excellent food, friendly employees, always  awesome vibes. They charge affordable rates and the food quality is fantastic. Highly recommended.
Excellent selection of wines, delicious appetizers and main courses. Love this place.

Don't let the dark, dated, original interior keep you away from this place. An affordable, authentically Italian restaurant, it has amazing food. Ordered a pizza with sausage, pepperoni, and mushrooms and it was one of the best pizzas I have ever had. The sauce was mildly sweet and tangy at the same time with a good balance of herbs and spices. It makes other pizzas' sauces taste bland. The sausage was huge and also had nice flavor to it. I would give this 5 stars if the interior were updated, but if it keeps the price down, I'll keep returning.

A hidden gem!   I can't count the number of times I have walked by and never stopped.    My family and I stopped in one night and enjoyed what we all agreed to be the best pizza we have ever eaten.   They have your typical deep dish Chicago pizza, pan pizza, and authentic Italian pizza...which is perfect.   Very nice atmosphere, great service!  Extremely reasonable prices and DELICIOUS....
Cool restaurant. Very classic vibe.
Worth a trip to the city Pizza is awesome Danny knows how to do it
Fast service, pricy yet delicious

Happened to come up on this cute place while looking for a different restaurant. So glad we switched gears and decided to go to Boni Vino instead! Loved the ambiance the moment we walked through the door.  Super friendly mixed with exceptional service and was treated like regulars, maybe even like family.  The food was quite delicious.  We started with the fried cheese sticks with marinara sauce and chicken noodle soup that was perfectly seasoned.  Then went on to the main meal, grilled salmon salad with vinaigrette . . .YUM! The Husband had the Barbecue beef sandwich with fries.  He finished every bite, and I swear I saw him try to lick the plate!!!    We finished everything off by sharing a slice of Turtle pie, which was outstanding! Would I recommend this place?  You Betcha . . . in a heartbeat!!!

Spaghetti is a specialty of mine everywhere I go, and I was disappointed in the meatballs. The pasta was where should be, but I tasted pork or something other than beef in the meatballs, and the seasonings were cheap. In addition the bread was crumple, once was enough.
Great food
Killer pizza and bucket o' beer deals, with two of the most fun bar keeps in Chicago! Great place to hangout.

Best pizza by the slice! The crust is made to perfection and melts in the mouth. Service is warm and friendly. The restaurant is cozy and has a very old world romantic feel to it, not pretentious at all. Just straightforward authentic Italian food.
Good pizza
Delicious food amazing place !!! but not if you are specifically Mexican Latino, go preparing as you could be a victim of racism by the staff.
If you want good cheap slices from cool people please come
Its was yummy

There are a few tables in the front and a nice bar in the back. The staff is friendly and the owner is active on the floor and really enjoys enter acting with the customers. The menu is very full, ranging from steak to pizza. The standard Italian dishes are on the menu and the history of the recipes stands out. The lasagna is the perfect balance of meat and cheese and the meatballs are not too large. The sauce is very full of tomato flavor and just a little sweet. When you are tired of thick crust Chicago pizza the pizza here is a great change. The crust is thin and the toppings are balanced. The salad choices are great.
To go cups. Need I say more!
Got a great steak sandwich to go.  I'm always treated well. The sandwich was FIRE!! Service was great.

(Translated by Google) [PL] Seduced people sitting inside, exposed the menu outside and the banner of Italian pizza - I looked for a quick dinner. The service was very helpful, but not intrusive - immediately liked it. Little time is a fast pizza and beer - I'll tell you that the pizza "individual" is really personal for it :) delicious. The waitress advised with beer - she did not allow to pee - again a plus.  I recommend to tourists who, like me, have a problem locating "what's edible here" and ok :)  (Original) [PL] Skuszona ludźmi siedzącymi w środku, wystawionym menu na zewnątrz i szyldem włoskiej pizzy - zajrzałam na szybki obiad. Obsługa bardzo pomocna, ale nie nachalna - od razu przypadła do gustu. Mało czasu, to szybka pizza i piwko - powiem Wam, że pizza "individual" jest naprawdę indywidualna :) za to pyszna. Z piwem kelnerka doradziła - nie pozwoliła wziąć "sików"- znowu plus.  Polecam turystom, którzy jak i ja mają problem w zlokalizowaniu "co tu jest jadalnego" i ok :)
Awful service is too long
Love Rose the bartender! Good food, great atmosphere, always a seat at the bar. Nice and dark too.
Pizza
Great food, friendly staff.
Great food
Excellent as always

The worse pizza I have ate in my life with inconvenience customer service, they look rude like they are not happy with you when you are there ,I really don't recommend this restaurant at all, the pizza really taste horrible not even cooked well if you ask for shrimp pizza you get only cheese with 2 shrimps in pizza crazy
Nice people good pizza
Great food and small place atmosphere.  First came about 10 years ago and will make sure to stop every time I'm in Chicago
food was out of this world, fantastic, calamari was great and service was amazing
Owner rude. Mistreat the servers
Cool Old Time pizza joint.
Best Italian restaurant ever 😍

First time to Chicago and a passerby pointed us to this little restaurant. Great food and great service. We were talked to like long time friends and our lovely waitress treated our son very kindly. Very cute, old time decor! Lots of pictures of people.
Gregarious owner, good pizza, neighborhood atmosphere
Some of the best pizza. Classic Chicago pizza spot. You can't go wrong with this.  Among the best sauce in the city
The pizza was great. The owner's behavior was strange and not very polite.
Good food.  Friendly staff.

It smells when you first walk in, like I cleaned carpet and sweat. I ordered a “SLICE” of pizza and i got two medium slices. It reminded me of the kind of pizza you buy at Walmart and make at home. Overall it wasn’t all that good, I won’t be going back. + there was some racist comments made by local customers and the bartender. The vibe wasn’t welcoming.
This place/other customers are racist!!!!

A completely romantic Quaint restaurant perfectly adorned with incident lighting classic nostalgic pictures and old school Booth seating very chic Very Old Town Chicago we loved it we love the food the pizza was amazing the pizza sauce was great vegetables refresh I highly recommend it to anyone in Chicago or visiting. 😍
Very nice 👍 service was great and Kathy and Jeri were the coolest chicks and the food was SOOOOOO good especially the pizza! I would rate 100 if I could!
Rose makes the place home along with Danny the host proprietor.  Good values for lunch specials, regulars are rewarded with a warm cozy atmosphere.

old school bar with large portions to share. decently priced lunch special. marinara sauce is on the sour-side, like a lemon zest or vinegar after-taste. it's lent, would have preferred a charcoal calamari but the grilled salmon salad saves the day. need to come back for pizzas according to all the sox fans.
Service a little bit slow, but my order was a good size portion. Savory too!
You made us feel very welcome thank you food was awesome. Now you'll have to come to Michigan and visit us at Lydia's down home cooking

For close to 35 years I have been attending this fine restaurant. I have visited several other places. Nothing compares to it in the loop. The restarant is very clean sanitary and well organized. The restrooms have plenty of soap and hot water. The pasta selection is outstanding. The thin crust pizza is one of the best in Chicago. The desert menu is tremendous. Even the cheeseburgers are amazing. Attend!!

It took 30 minutes just to get a cup of soup. I ended up spending more than an hour here and I dined alone. The food was just okay, and didn't seem like it was worth the price. The server, although friendly, seemed kind of erratic. I am disappointed because this place has potential, with its nice atmosphere and its proximity to the L stop and the Metra station.
Good food

Very rude woman who answered the phone when calling about a Grubhub order that we never received. I was simply calling for an update (after an hour of not recieving my food) and was rudely interrupted by the woman who answered the phone stating “we don’t have any drivers”. In any type of sales / service job - you should never be rude to a customer. Do not give this place your business
Attend an annual Fat Tuesday for past 4 years. Staff is pleasant. Place needs an update
Ok.. Wish they would cook the pizza well done
Great pizza
Very good Italian restaurant located in the financial district.  Known for its pizza, it also has a complete Italian menu. A hidden gem with excellent service
Da Best!💙

The menu prices are definitely not correct! The waitress was very disrespectful when I asked why the total price was more than what was shown on the web. I am definitely not going to return because of my experience with the waitress. Customer service is just as Important as the quality of the food being prepared. The food however was tasty, compliments to the chef.

Quaint, friendly, local, family owned.  This is an older establishment in downtown Chicago with some charm and history hanging on its walls.  I ordered the 12" thin crust pizza to-go and loved it.  The order was filled quickly, reasonably priced for a pizza of that size from a downtown establishment.  And attentive service.  The next time I'm in downtown Chicago and craving Italian food, I'll probably drop in again and eat in the restaurant.
Good place for dinner and a drink before going on Metra
Fried calamari was good. Other items didn't taste that good. Very basic bar. Our server was rude and condescending. Place had a weird smell
Great #pizza #family #staff all top notch. Going over 30 years
It's an old school Italian restaurant.
Great atmosphere and service, but the pizza tasted like a boboli crust you get at a grocery store

Food was very basic pizza was just reheated mozzarella sticks were cold absolutely nothing authentic about this place...... waitress was over the top condescending in a way felt rushed. The special that drew me in was $5 slice including drink. Was not charged that when I asked about she said no sorry this is the price I’m sitting next to window with sign it clearly says $5 it’s not the price so much as the attitude and frankly the food wasn’t worth $3 let alone $15. Very disappointed read the reviews before I ordered probably had their friends and family write reviews. No free refills $2 for a smal glass of coke that was mostly ice. Disappointed all the way around!!! Don’t waste ur time or money!!!!
Rose the Bartender and Missy the waitress rock!
Only had one of the Salads but all good on service and the quick bite I had. Classic family owned Italian joint.
It's  ok
Excellent service, nice atmosphere, and the pizza was divine - 100% recommended!
Workers are misogynistic and rude telling FEMALE customers they need to smile to get their takeout order.
Took me 20 min to get a slice, also lady didnt tell me a drink came with my slice

Definitely a 'neighborhood' place, and about as authentic Chicago as you can get in the South Loop.  Good food, the owner Danny always seems to be there and runs a tight ship.  And yes, he'll introduce himself and sit down with you.  Definitely NOT a chain restaurant....but one you'll remember for years.
Great food excellent service
Very comfortable atmosphere. Danny the owner is a great host.
Love the BBQ chicken pizza. It's always been a favorite and it's like no other I've ever tasted.

GREAT PIZZA. My gf and I went here hungry and we were not disappointed. We destroyed a large pizza and walked away stuffed. The price was reasonable and our waiter was attentive to our needs. It's a great place for thin crust pizza. I don't know how the deep dish is but I could only assume it's great!
Terrible pizza
The owner is very rude I was looking at some pictures in the hallway right by the bathroom and he remarked as I came out what you hang around for

Came here with my family,  my sister recommended it from her time working downtown years ago.  Only thing worse than the pizza was the a-hole owner. Guy tried to come off funny right away by trying to insult me. He kept cussing in front of my kids and bragged about how he's a big time restaurant owner for so many years. Pointing at a picture of him on the wall in a boat. Lol, laughable. ..... guy is an arogant jack ass...funny part the pizza is by far the worst pizza I've ate in Chicago. .... and he braggs about how they charge for refills on soda don't waste your money and time. ....go to giordanos, lou malnattis, or gino's
The pizza was awesome and the service was good. It was not busy when I went there though.
Old school, no frills, great slice.
Best dive in town.
good place eat
Neighborhood environment

Horrible... Yea I know I'm from NY and I'm hard to please but God damn the pizza tasted like digornio from the local supermarket...    I don't usually wrote reviews .. But beware .. Plus...frozen calamari
Nice old school Italian vibe with great thin slice pizza.
Quiet place, nice food, infrastructure somehow old, friendly staff.
Excellent pizza and pasta. Old world style. Great quiet spot for a date.

Friendly atmosphere,  the owners humor caught me off guard at first, but after shaking my hand and welcoming me to the neighboorhood I could tell he was genuine.  Easily offended people might find it awkward.  I had the personal pizza 7".  Really surprised how good it was!  It is on the sweeter side, but I prefer that style, others may not.  Food came fast, owner conversated while I was waiting.  The scenery isn't high class, but I didn't come here expecting to be taken away by the environment.  Total Bill was $14.20 for a personal pizza, some cheese sticks and water.  I will come back.
Classic family owned Chicago thin crust pizza, bar food, and beverages. Fine with kids if you are visiting the city as a tourist, or good for inexpensive drinks and snacks after work in the Loop.
Good food and service.
Great food and bartenders!
Excellent atmosphere! Food was amazing
Great place to linger and talk...great prices...and I love their antipasto salad.
Luv this place

Had a great experience here yesterday with my family. We arrived very early in the day and felt very welcome. We ordered a basic pepperoni pizza. It was excellent. Our 5-year old is very picky, and I think that was the most of anything I have ever seen him eat. When we got home (Indianapolis) he asked "You know what my favorite part of Chicago was?" "The pizza restaraunt!!!"  Incredibly friendly people and great food. We hope to visit again.
I had a margarita and the tomato base was just too pasty, overall not great but was decent enough. A bit pricey for what you get.

I only had 30 minutes for lunch.  Walked in a told Bonnie I needed a quick slice.  Without missing a beat she asked 'cheese or pepperoni?' and told me where to sit.  Not long later two slices and a Coke showed up, and they were exactly what I needed.  On the way out Bonnie introduced herself.  What a sweetie!

Been there twice. The first time the food was good, very authentic home made Italian food. The second time I went there, the food was horrible! I ordered chicken marinara with spaghetti. The chicken was rubbery and the spaghetti unspectacular and both were largely flavorless.  I'm not a cook but i think I could do better with spaghetti! These inconsistencies in food tells me that they have lost their pride in cooking, what some would consider hearty Italian food. I don't think I'll ever go back. The server was nice and very attentive, though.
A little gem I stumbled upon. While heading home. In time for dinner. Great place to sit and chill, have a burger and a beer.

Pizza was good, but staff was so unfriendly. The bartender acted like she could care less to help you. I ordered a slice a pizza and she took so long I asked for it to go and she seemed like annoyed her. I opened it up to wat it and she gave me something that I didn’t order. I would never go back there with the service I received.
One of those great little restaurants hidden away under the L-tracks in downtown Chicago.  Great lunch menu and the owner treats everyone like a personal friend.

OK I wish I would have found this restaurant back when I lived in Chicago. The owner and his staff and family welcomed our group like we were family. The food and particularly the sauce is incredible, the pizza is delicious and the ambiance is old school Italian restaurant liked you walked onto a movie lot ... but it's real and extremely affordable! Stop in at the bar next door for a night cap "botta bing"... "forget about it"
Horrible guest service had to get my money and walk out racist whites

Pizza was incredible. I mean awesome. Coke was tiny and no refills which is B.S. waitress was ok. Did her job because she had to not because she wanted to. Big difference. Cool photos on the wall nice place I would go again absolutely but I would request a much friendlier waitress. She was just DULL. No personality. But Dam the pizza was good crispy crust awesome sauce. Good cheese sausage and mushroom.
Great pizza very quiet.
Friendly staff, hilarious owner.. Way too pricey for me but the homemade pasta is to die for.

Food was good so that is the only reason for the 2 stars. Service was SLOW. Coke was flat and some off brand. Server was really inconsistent on paying attention to customers. One person walked in, sat down and left after waiting 5 minutes for anyone to even greet her. 1st time there, last time there.
I swear this was the best spaghetti and meatballs I have ever had.
Friendly staff, good pizza and cold beer. What more could you ask for
Old school Italian food. Eggplant parm sandwich is very good
Came in an hour before closing, refused to do anything but pizza. Pizza was ok, wanted chicken parm though.

Stopped in for a quick bite while in town. Exactly the Chicago experience I was looking for! excellent food,  Staff was great and very helpful guiding this tourist on how to get to a ball game. I'll stop in here every time I'm back in town. Thanks!
A great place to go while waiting for a train!
Great food at a fair price. The pizza had an amazing sweet sauce.
Great food and service
Good place for lunch.  Great soup!

This is a classic old-school Chicago Italian restaurant.  The wait staff is very nice, and the owner often comes up and introduces himself to the diners and sings with the juke box.  Very reasonably priced food.
Overpriced and outdated. There is a history here apparently but the mediocre food does not merit the high prices. Friendly and clean, but don't expect anything spectacular.
Good pizza...
Never ever try pan pizza. Thick shabby pizza with Heinz BBQ sauce.
(Translated by Google) Very good Italian food  (Original) Muy buena comida Italiana

High points.....the food is good.  Nothing over the top, but great food at Chicago Loop reasonable prices.  Problem 1.seems like "A Good Ole Boys Club".....if you are not a regular, good luck!  Problem 2.  waited 45 minutes for a Flatbread.  Enough said (not the first time btw).......fool me once, shame on you, fool me twice, shame on me.  Problem 3.  (Mind you lunch time) .....the second the owner left, bartender cranked the music like it was a Friday night.  I had a work call that I couldn't answer due to the loud music. (She bragged about him being gone)  TLDR:.....GOOD FOOD....PIZZA AND FLATBREAD IN WHICH YOU CAN'T GO WRONG. GNOCCHI ARE WONDERFUL TOO.  TLDR:  LONG WAIT TIMES.  HAVE TO BE A REGULAR FOR GOOD SERVICE.  On lunch, order ahead.  45 minutes for a BBQ flatbread.
food is good but pricey
This is a nice friendly place to grab a quick Italian meal. Good red wines by the glass.
Authentic Italian Food. Excellent.
username: Medical Hearing Assoc. LTD Kathleen Haasch, Au.D

caption: Really good place for Italian cuisine at affordable prices. The ambiance is great!  Dimly lit with red and white checkered tablecloths and wooden chairs. Love their pasta and pizza!
Affordable good food
First time visit, loved the ribs! The staff was really friendly, professional and social. Will definitely visit again.

Although the chicken was breaded well and was an actual piece of chicken and not a patty (I've actually been served that in other places!) I didn't care for the sauce...which can't be helped I guess.  So the flavor was just a bit off for me. Hence the 3 stars.  I still ate every bite and enjoyed my meal.  They were very crowded for lunch and the poor waitress wanted to cry, but she was doing the best she could and I had no complaints.  The owner/manager (I assume, didn't introduce himself) checked on us to make sure we were doing ok, which I appreciated and seemed to care sincerely about his customers, which is actually surprisingly hard to find.

Is it a Michelin star or Zagat rated restaurant, no...but I like the people and I like the food. I was there yesterday evening with a friend and while there were at least two parties going on and a large group in the main area too, as well as several other diners, we were promptly greeted and seated. Danny, the owner, welcomed us at our table, our food was brought out in a timely manner and our glasses were never empty. To me, as well as getting good food at a good price, it's an experience eating here and I love the experience.
Great local charm, food was everthing you would expect from an Italian restaurant that knows it's sauce. Only regret, no IPA on tap

This place was disgusting I'm sorry I never would want to say that about a persons restaurant but this place was absolutely horrible it says fine Italian food I got the Italian beef and sausage combo sandwich and a chicken sandwich both flavorless and bland with the Italian beef tasted sort of like metal and the chicken sandwich was dry no mayo or nothing I DO NOT RECOMMEND THIS PLACE!!!!! The fries was the only good part and to be honest one of those market box digiorno pizzas to bake would of been a better choice

I was looking primarily for a place that would deliver to my hotel. I had seen this place on the bus ride up and down Michigan Avenue.  I ordereed their pasta. It came so quickly and was so inexpensive that I admit my expectations were low. The pasta was really terrific and so was the garlic bread. This place seemed to offer options for vegetarians as well. Definitely my choice for eating in.

The experience is wonderful. If you want to take in the full Chicago Italian experience from the people native to the area, this is the spot. To me, it's a place right out of tv or a movie. The lighting, the ambience. The owner sat with us for a bit, conversated  some,  played music for us from his old school jukebox, and even included us in conversation with others in the restaurant. Overall it was exactly the experience I wanted coming to Chicago. It was epic!
five nights at freddy's ! real pizza freddy kill grand !

Our food took forever to come and we were told its because they were "backed up"... there were maybe only 6 tables seated in the entire place. Our waitress gave me the wrong check, didn't listen when we said we didn't want anymore bread, and just generally wasn't around. On top of that the food was mediocre at best.
it was actually pretty good. decent prices for decent food, what more can you ask?
Excellent pizza from a hole in the wall pizza place. Love it! I have it every time!

Chicago pizza isn't all about deep dish.  That's tourism propaganda.  It's really about making pizza that would piss off New Yorkers.  This is one of my absolute favorite examples.  Square cut thin with high quality ingredients and tons of cheese.  They know what they are doing.  It's a dive in a way but I prefer the "it has character" euphemism.  If you want "real" Chi town pizza stop into this place.  If you simply must have deep dish go to Peaquods.

Truly a giant hole in the wall with rats in it. Like one of the reviewers said, couldn't have it put it any better... "the owner is a big fat ugly slob and smells like body odor and was very rude" a sorry face to the human race the slob walks around in shorts in summer where you have to witness and make your self sick of all the boil growth on him! Highly I do not recommend going here get the food next door from Alantis...oh yeah, and all those waitresses, rejects from other places, they are rude rude rude, and the food is just waste of money!
The thin crust pizza is solid and they still have the same registers from 30 years ago.
Only been here twice but the place is wonderful! Love the pics!! Much bigger than I thought

Went here the other day to try their pizza, walking in i got bombarded with bums begging me for spare change. I looked past that and it took forever to get my pizza and the crust is like rubber. the owner is a big fat ugly slob and smells like body odor and was very rude. I do not recommend going here get the food next door its better!
A great hole in the wall to visit after a long day of work.
